Detailed Description

Definitions for PPU-side array-queue (a queue backed by an array) operations.

Note:
If the size of the queue (# of items the queue can accomodate) is less than 127, consider to use of ctk_queue instead.

Store only small objects in the queue; for large objects, you should consider storing only references (EA addr) of them and outlining the data.

Function Documentation

int ctk_genericq_create ( ctk_genericq_ea_t *  queue,
int  item_size,
int  capacity 
)

Creates and initializes a new queue object. The created queue object must be destroyed by ctk_genericq_destroy to release the allocated resources.

Parameters:
[out] queue - a pointer to the queue reference
[in] item_size - the size of the item
[in] capacity - the size of the queue (# of items it accomodates)

int ctk_genericq_deq ( ctk_genericq_ea_t  queue,
void *  item 
)

Dequeues an item from the given queue object. This could block if the queue is empty.

Parameters:
[in] queue - the queue reference
[out] item - the dequeued item

int ctk_genericq_destroy ( ctk_genericq_ea_t  queue  ) 

Destroys the given queue object.

Parameters:
[in] queue - the queue reference to be freed

int ctk_genericq_enq ( ctk_genericq_ea_t  queue,
void *  item 
)

Enqueues an item to the given queue object. This could block if the queue is full (i.e. the current item count == capacity).

Parameters:
[in] queue - the queue reference
[in] item - the item to be enqueued

static int ctk_genericq_get_capacity ( ctk_genericq_ea_t  queue  )  [inline, static]

Returns the capacity (size) of the given queue

static int ctk_genericq_get_remaining_capacity ( ctk_genericq_ea_t  queue  )  [inline, static]

Returns the number of additional elements that the given queue can accept without blocking.

static int ctk_genericq_get_remaining_count ( ctk_genericq_ea_t  queue  )  [inline, static]

Returns the number elements in the given queue.

int ctk_genericq_peek ( ctk_genericq_ea_t  queue,
void *  item 
)

Peeks an item from the given queue object. The queue itself isn't modified.

Parameters:
[in] queue - the queue reference
[out] item - the peeked item
Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) if the queue is non-empty and an item is successfully peeked, errno (CTK_ERROR_NO_DATA) otherwise.

int ctk_genericq_trydeq ( ctk_genericq_ea_t  queue,
void *  item 
)

Tries to dequeue an item to the given queue object. If the queue is empty, the call does not block and returns CTK_ERROR_RETRY.

Parameters:
[in] queue - the queue reference
[out] item - the dequeued item
Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) if the item is successfully enqueued, errno (CTK_ERROR_RETRY or others) on failure.

int ctk_genericq_tryenq ( ctk_genericq_ea_t  queue,
void *  item 
)

Tries to enqueue an item to the given queue object. If the queue is full, the call does not block and returns CTK_ERROR_RETRY.

Parameters:
[in] queue - the queue reference
[in] item - the item to be enqueued
Returns:
0 (CTK_SUCCESS) if the item is successfully enqueued, errno (CTK_ERROR_RETRY or others) on failure.
